stories.original_headline: Astronomers ring in the new year with a stunning galaxy collision
stories.original_summary: The Champagne Cluster is a rare and beautiful example of two galaxy clusters smashing together. Its festive name comes from both its New Year’s Eve discovery and its bubbly appearance in space. Images reveal superheated gas and galaxies spread across a massive collision zone. Astronomers believe thi
stories.fantasy_headline: Stargazers Witness Celestial Dance of the Bubbly Constellation!
stories.fantasy_story: The Stargazers' Guild has unveiled a breathtaking vision in the night sky. Two grand celestial kingdoms, known as the Bubbly Constellation, were seen swirling together in a magnificent cosmic embrace. Their magic-filled gases mingled, painting the heavens with shimmering light. This rare event was discovered on the eve of the New Year's Festival.

stories.original_headline: The deep ocean has a missing link and scientists finally found it
stories.original_summary: Scientists have uncovered why big predators like sharks spend so much time in the ocean’s twilight zone. The answer lies with mid-sized fish such as the bigscale pomfret, which live deep during the day and rise at night to feed, linking deep and surface food webs. Using satellite tags, researchers t
stories.fantasy_headline: Ocean Wizards Uncover Mystery of the Deepwater Sustenance Chain.
stories.fantasy_story: The Ocean Wizards' Guild has finally solved a long-standing riddle of the Sunken Gloom. They discovered that cunning Shadow-fin fish, living deep by day, rise at night to feed, connecting the deep sea's bounty to the surface's Great Leviathans. Using enchanted markings, the scholars tracked these vital creatures. This explains why mighty predators frequent these mysterious depths.

stories.original_headline: You can’t trust your eyes to tell you what’s real anymore, says the head of Instagram
stories.original_summary: Instagram boss Adam Mosseri is closing out 2025 with a 20-images-deep dive into what a new era of "infinite synthetic content" means as it all becomes harder and harder to distinguish from reality, and the old, more personal Instagram feed that he says has been "dead" for years. Last year, The Verge
stories.fantasy_headline: Master of Scrying Pool Warns of Shifting Glamours and False Visions.
stories.fantasy_story: The esteemed Master of the Grand Scrying Pool, Adam, has issued a grave warning. He cautions that new mimicry spells create fabricated fancies, making it near impossible to tell true visions from false ones. The ancient scrolls, once filled with personal tales, have long since faded. People must now be wary of what their eyes perceive.
